text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition cl-address

Language: es

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Address 0..*AddressTipo de dato para agregar la dirección
extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slices for extension Content/Rules for all slices
extension:Geolocalizacion S0..1(Complex)The absolute geographic location
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/geolocation
use S0..1codeDefinición del tipo de domicilio home | work | temp | old (requerido)
line S0..1stringCalle o avenida, número y casa o depto
city S0..1stringCampo para Comuna de residencia
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionCódigo de Comunas
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:comunas S1..1CodeableConceptCódigos para Comunas en Chile
URL: https://hl7chile.cl/fhir/ig/clcore/StructureDefinition/ComunasCl
Binding: Códigos de Comunas en Chile (required)
district S0..1stringCampo para Provincia de Residencia
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionCódigo de Regiones
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:provincias S1..1CodeableConceptCódigos para Provincias en Chile
URL: https://hl7chile.cl/fhir/ig/clcore/StructureDefinition/ProvinciasCl
Binding: Códigos de Provincias en Chile (required)
state S0..1stringCampo para la Región
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionCódigo de Regiones
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:regiones S1..1CodeableConceptCódigos para Regiones en Chile
URL: https://hl7chile.cl/fhir/ig/clcore/StructureDefinition/RegionesCl
Binding: Códigos de Regiones en Chile (required)
country S0..1stringCampo para País de Residencia
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionCódigo de Países
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:paises S1..1CodeableConceptCódigo de Países
URL: https://hl7chile.cl/fhir/ig/clcore/StructureDefinition/CodigoPaises
Binding: Códigos de Países (required)

Documentation for this format

name: ClAddress
title: CL Address
copyright: Usado con el permiso de HL7 International, todos los derechos resevados en los Licencias de HL7 Internacional.

element.short: Tipo de dato para agregar la dirección
element.definition: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats).  This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations which might not be valid for mail delivery.  There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: Formato Chileno para la definición de direcciones

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).
element.comment: The extension can be further extended to include unique geolocation identifiers, confidence, altitude, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Definición del tipo de domicilio home | work | temp | old (requerido)
element.definition: Se especifica el tipo de dirección notificada. Esto debe ser segn los códigos definidos por HL7 FHIR
element.comment: Applications can assume that an address is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.
element.requirements: Allows an appropriate address to be chosen from a list of many.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary or old address etc.for a current/permanent one

element.definition: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.
element.comment: The definition of Address states that "address is intended to describe postal addresses, not physical locations". However, many applications track whether an address has a dual purpose of being a location that can be visited as well as being a valid delivery destination, and Postal addresses are often used as proxies for physical locations (also see the [Location](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/location.html#) resource).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

element.definition: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
element.comment: Can provide both a text representation and parts. Applications updating an address SHALL ensure that  when both text and parts are present,  no content is included in the text that isn't found in a part.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 + XAD.3 + XAD.4 + XAD.5 + XAD.6

element.short: Calle o avenida, número y casa o depto
element.definition: Aquí se escribe toda la dirección completa
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: Campo para Comuna de residencia.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
Código de Comunas

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Esta extensión que permite codiificar las Comunas en Chile en el campo de Dirección

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Campo para Provincia de Residencia. Se usa el valueSet de códigos de provicias definidos a nivel naciona.
element.comment: District is sometimes known as county, but in some regions 'county' is used in place of city (municipality), so county name should be conveyed in city instead.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
Código de Regiones

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Esta extensión que permite codificar las Provincias en Chile en el campo de Dirección

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Campo Región. Se usa el valueSet de códigos de regiones definidos a nivel naciona.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
Código de Regiones

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Esta extensión que permite codificar las Regiones en Chile en el campo de Dirección

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Campo para País de Residencia
element.comment: ISO 3166 3 letter codes can be used in place of a human readable country name.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
Código de Países

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Esta extensión incluye códigos de países

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value

element.short: Time period when address was/is in use
element.definition: Time period when address was/is in use.
element.requirements: Allows addresses to be placed in historical context.
